page.title: 11HANSLOPE CHURCH TOWER TRIP 2
page.content:
I nearly fell because of that step and they were very narrow stairs.There were only a few windows on the stair case. Terry Frampton
To measure the height of the church spire you need a clinometer and a measuring tape.We measured from the bottom of the church to say 80 metres away.Then get the clinometer and point it up to the spire and read off how many degrees it said.Mine said 35.On graph paper you make a scale drawing of the distance from the church tower to the clinometer and using a protractor mark off the degrees.When you have marked this ,draw a straight line through the mark you made and then that gives you the answer on the vertical scale.My answer was 57 metres.
